title: Human super-predators not always ‘super-scary’ to wildlife, finds study
content: Animals in areas exposed to lethal humans tend to be more vigilant and spend less time foraging. In contrast, responses to non-lethal humans, such as tourists or researchers are weaker and more variable

title: All 20 uniform sets for the 2026 World Baseball Classic, from Japan to Team USA
content: The World Baseball Classic is back this spring -- and so are new uniforms. Twenty teams from across the globe will vie for the title this March, with the game's biggest stars set to represent their respective nations.  Shohei Ohtani  will trade the  Los Angeles Dodgers ' customary blue for the colors of Japan, while  Aaron Judge  will swap the  New York Yankees ' iconic pinstripes for Team USA's red, white and blue. Each nation will have a white home jersey as well as an away jersey of a solid base color. Here's a complete roundup of each squad's look for the tournament.

title: Loosening pyjama string is 'attempt to rape': SC sets aside Allahabad HC ruling
content: The Supreme Court has overturned a controversial Allahabad High Court ruling, declaring that groping a woman and untying her pyjama string constitutes an "attempt to rape." The apex court emphasized the need for judicial compassion and empathy in handling sexual offense cases, reviving stringent charges under the Pocso Act. A committee will now develop guidelines to foster sensitivity in judges.

title: Show of force? US sends 50+ fighter jets to Middle East amid talks with Iran
content: Amidst high-stakes nuclear talks with Iran, the US has significantly bolstered its military presence in the Middle East, deploying over 50 advanced fighter jets and extending troop deployments. This buildup, including air defense systems and cargo flights, coincides with indirect negotiations in Geneva aimed at a potential nuclear deal.  President Trump has previously threatened military action.

title: For reels, biker yanked doors of moving vehicles in Delhi, arrested after video goes viral
content: A 22-year-old man was arrested in Delhi for allegedly opening doors of moving vehicles while riding his bike, an act captured in a viral video. Police are searching for his accomplice. In a separate incident, another man was apprehended for performing bike stunts after India's cricket victory.

title: ‘We deserve what we’ve got’: Australia face backlash after ‘shambolic’ T20 World Cup exit
content: Australia's T20 World Cup journey ended abruptly, sparking outrage over their bowling frailties and questionable selections.  Former spinner Brad Hogg labelled the campaign "shambolic," highlighting a severe lack of bowling depth.  Injuries and strategic missteps, including the handling of Steve Smith, contributed to the stunning group-stage exit, leaving the team facing urgent structural reviews.

title: Salim Khan health update: Salman's father is on ventilator support - Report
content: Renowned screenwriter Salim Khan has been hospitalized at Lilavati Hospital, currently requiring ventilator support. Medical professionals have diagnosed him with internal bleeding stemming from a spike in blood pressure and ruptured blood vessels. He has undergone surgery  today. Read the full article to know more in detail.

title: Airbnb CEO says Google is no longer ‘good enough’ for company's growth
content: Airbnb CEO Brian Chesky revealed that AI chatbots are now generating more revenue for the company than traditional search engines like Google.  He stated that traffic from platforms such as ChatGPT and Gemini converts at a higher rate, highlighting AI's integral role in Airbnb's growth and operational efficiency.

title: Rohit Shetty house firing: 7 lured with quick money for ‘mission’ by ‘Hindu Sainiks’, say cops
content: Investigations reveal the Shubham Lonkar gang used social media and local contacts to recruit shooters for the firing outside Rohit Shetty's home. Youths were promised money, fame, and identity. The main shooter received an advance payment. Police arrested seven more individuals, identifying two modules involved in the operation. Financial details are under verification as accused statements vary.

title: Bank holiday today: Are banks open on closed on February 18? Check state-wise details
content: Planning a bank visit? Be aware that Indian banks observe both national and state holidays, leading to varied closures. Today, February 18, Sikkim banks are closed for Losar. Maharashtra observes Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj Jayanti on February 19, while Mizoram and Arunachal Pradesh celebrate State Day on February 20. Remember, second and fourth Saturdays also mean no branch operations.

title: Pakistan face must-win scenario, must beat Namibia to qualify for Super 8s
content: Pakistan fans express cautious optimism for a rematch with India, but the team must first secure a win against Namibia. Despite a loss to India, spinners Usman Tariq and Saim Ayub showed promise. Pakistan need to address bowling lapses and batting concerns, especially Shaheen Afridi's form, to advance in the tournament.

title: YouTube down in US: Company gives ‘final update’, explains what caused the outage
content: YouTube faced a widespread outage impacting users globally. The video platform experienced issues with its recommendations system, preventing videos from appearing. This disruption affected YouTube.com, the app, YouTube Music, and YouTube Kids. The problem has now been resolved, and all services are back to normal. Millions of users reported the downtime.

title: 'No threat but vigilance is necessary': RSS chief renews 'united Hindus' pitch; backs 3-child policy
content: RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat urged Hindu families to have at least three children, citing concerns over a declining population. He emphasized uniting and empowering the Hindu community, advocating for the detection and deportation of infiltrators. Bhagwat also stressed the importance of social harmony, addressing caste divisions, and uplifting the disadvantaged, asserting India's potential to guide the world.

title: 'Jai Ho': PM Modi's car ride with French President Emmanuel Macron in Mumbai
content: Prime Minister Modi and French President Macron elevated India-France ties to a 'special global strategic partnership' during the latter's visit. The leaders pledged expanded cooperation in defense, trade, and critical minerals, signing 21 agreements, including a defense pact and a joint venture for Hammer missile manufacturing.

title: Google’s ex CEO Eric Schmidt warns America: We are running out of electricity
content: Former Google CEO Eric Schmidt warns America faces an electricity shortage, needing 92 gigawatts more power for AI growth.  Massive data centers are straining the grid, with projections showing a significant increase in consumption and potential price hikes.  Tech giants are pledging to cover electricity costs amid these growing concerns.

title: Ouch, my joints! Why your 20s and 30s are no longer immune to joint pain
content: Joint pain is no longer exclusive to older adults; young people in their 20s and 30s are increasingly experiencing it. Sedentary lifestyles, poor posture, and ignoring early warning signs like stiffness or pain after exercise contribute to this trend. Experts urge prompt medical evaluation to prevent permanent damage and emphasize proper exercise and body awareness.

title: Dwarka car accident: Accused’s father breaks silence says, 'very sorry, regretful, was not in Delhi'
content: A grieving mother is demanding an underage driver be tried as an adult and stricter action against his father after her son's death. The father expressed regret but claimed he wasn't present during the accident. The case echoes a 2016 incident, reigniting debates on parental responsibility for minors driving high-end vehicles.

title: Stock market today: Nifty50 opens near 25,700; BSE Sensex flat in trade
content: Stock market today: Indian equity benchmarks opened flat in trade on Wednesday. While the 50-share index Nifty was near 25,700, the 30-share BSE Sensex was down marginally.

title: Rhode Island League suspended after man kills ex-wife, son at Hockey game
content: Aidan Dorgan, 23, and his mother Rhonda Dorgan, 52, were shot and killed during a Rhode Island Interscholastic League hockey game at Lynch Arena in Pawtucket. Police say the shooter, Robert Dorgan, 56, later took his own life. The league suspended games. Two relatives remain in critical condition as investigators review motive and online posts.

title: Alabama WR Ryan Williams, 19, announces engagement to Alexis Hill
content: Alabama wide receiver Ryan Williams, 19, announced his engagement to 25-year-old Alexis Hill on Valentine’s Day. Hill, who has one child from a previous relationship, shared photos of her ring on Instagram. NFL insider Dov Kleiman reported the news on X, leading to mixed reactions online. Some fans celebrated, while others debated the couple’s six-year age gap.

title: Ronda Rousey vs Gina Carano: Net worth, earnings & career comparison
content: Ronda Rousey and Gina Carano built wealth through different paths after helping popularize women’s MMA. Rousey, a former UFC champion and WWE star, holds an estimated $14 million net worth driven by fight purses, endorsements, and film roles. Carano, worth about $4–5 million, transitioned from MMA to acting, starring in films and The Mandalorian, building a steady Hollywood career.

title: 5% reservation for Muslims scrapped in Maharashtra
content: Maharashtra's Social Justice Department has revoked the 5% reservation previously granted to certain Muslim communities under the SEBC category. This decision, based on court rulings and existing legal frameworks concerning the 2014 policy, impacts admissions to educational institutions and government job recruitments. The earlier order has now been officially cancelled.

title: Bengaluru bank employee dies after being hit by speeding bike; CCTV footage emerges
content: A 27-year-old bank employee, Yogeshwari, tragically lost her life after being struck by a speeding Bullet motorcycle while crossing a road in Rajajinagar. The accident occurred during her lunch break as she was returning with a food packet. The biker, a student, also sustained severe head injuries and is undergoing treatment.

title: 'He must be looked after and respected': Sourav Ganguly backs appeal for Imran Khan
content: Former India captain Sourav Ganguly has joined 13 other ex-skippers in urging Pakistan to treat Imran Khan with dignity and provide proper medical care amid concerns over his health in prison. The signatories expressed profound concern over Khan's deteriorating vision and limited access to specialists and family, stressing humane treatment for the former leader.

title: US, Japan seal ‘massive’ trade deal; Tokyo to invest $550 bn in America
content: President Trump announced a "MASSIVE Trade Deal with Japan," unveiling $36 billion in Japanese investment for US projects. These initiatives, focusing on energy, power generation, and advanced manufacturing, are the first under Japan's $550 billion commitment. The deal includes slashing US tariffs on Japanese imports to 15%.

title: Suddenly throwing up? Could it be the weather or a stomach bug? Doctor explains
content: Sudden vomiting can strike without warning. Doctors explain it is often a stomach bug. However, changing weather can also play a role. This can weaken immunity and affect food. Experts advise seeking medical help for severe symptoms like blood in stool or high fever. Rehydration and bland foods are recommended for home care. Rest is crucial for recovery.

title: Modi, Macron launch H125 helicopter assembly line
content: India and France are deepening their strategic ties with a new helicopter assembly line in Karnataka and a potential multi-billion dollar Rafale jet deal. Prime Minister Modi highlighted the nations' shared trust and commitment to manufacturing and exporting advanced technology.

title: Delhi wakes up to rain as IMD warns of further storm activity across North India
content: Delhi experienced pre-dawn showers as a Western Disturbance brought rain, thunderstorms, and gusty winds to north and central India. Neighboring states like Punjab and Haryana face alerts for hailstorms and intense thunderstorms. Meanwhile, the western Himalayas are seeing isolated rain and snow, while the eastern coast grapples with dense fog.

title: Silent chanting vs loud chanting: Meaning, benefits and what works better
content: Chanting, a traditional science, aligns the human body with the universe through sound. It progresses from loud, physical engagement (Vaikhari) to soft, mental focus (Upanshu), and finally to silent, internal repetition (Manasika). This journey refines thought patterns and shapes perception, moving the mantra from audible sound to subtle awareness.

title: Two ducks, no worries! Abhishek Sharma 'has his plans sorted'
content: Despite two ducks in the T20 World Cup, India's team management is backing opener Abhishek Sharma's approach, emphasizing his clear plans and mindset. Batting coach Sitanshu Kotak stated that the high-risk nature of T20 means players will get out, and the focus remains on his form and clarity, not just the recent lean run.

title: Top stocks to buy: Stock recommendations for today - check list
content: Stock market recommendations: Mehul Kothari, DVP - Technical Research, Anand Rathi Shares and Stock Brokers recommends buying Bharti Airtel, Finolex Industries, and Coal India as the top stock picks for February 18, 2026. The expert shares a detailed outlook on each stock along with target prices:

title: 'Raise India-made component' in Rafale deal: Rajnath to France
content: India has urged France to increase the 'Make-in-India' component to 50% for the upcoming 114 Rafale fighter jet deal, including engine manufacturing and overhauling. This comes as both nations renewed their defense cooperation agreement for another decade, also agreeing to manufacture Hammer missiles in India.

title: Why today's match could define Pakistan’s T20 World Cup fate
content: Pakistan faces a do-or-die T20 World Cup clash against Namibia, needing a win to keep Super 8 hopes alive after a disappointing loss to India.  Concerns linger over senior players Babar Azam and Shaheen Afridi's form, while selection changes are being considered.  Namibia, though out, seeks momentum, but for Pakistan, it's a simple win-or-go-home scenario.

title: Adani bets big on AI data centres, to invest $100bn
content: Adani Group plans a massive $100 billion investment by 2035 to establish renewable energy-powered, AI-ready data centers across India. This initiative aims to foster a $250 billion AI infrastructure ecosystem, building on existing partnerships and expanding renewable energy capacity to support India's ambition as an AI hub.

title: 'My journey started with that one': Hardik Pandya reflects on turning point of his career
content: Hardik Pandya reflects on the pivotal 2016 T20 World Cup final over against Bangladesh, crediting it as the career-defining moment that shaped him. He now aims to unlock his full batting potential, admitting he's only used 40% of it, with his girlfriend Mahieka helping him rediscover his passion for the game through intense training sessions.

title: 'I joined work on 15th day of my husband’s death': How a single mom beat the odds to lead a brand
content: After a tragic accident claimed her husband, Meghali Gupta was compelled to take over the family's 230-year-old jewelry business. Despite initial challenges and personal grief, she dedicated herself to learning every aspect of the business. Her commitment and empathy eventually earned her the respect of long-time employees, allowing her to successfully lead the legacy brand.

title: US military strikes three alleged drug-trafficking boats, killing 11 people
content: US forces struck three vessels in the eastern Pacific and Caribbean. Eleven individuals on board were killed. These actions are part of a campaign that began in September. The US military previously justified lethal strikes against suspected drug traffickers. This approach contrasts with earlier law enforcement methods.

title: Amitabh Bachchan's granddaughter Navya Naveli Nanda on not joining films despite Bachchan legacy
content: Despite being born into the illustrious Bachchan family, Navya Naveli Nanda says she never felt any pressure to step into the world of acting. In a recent conversation, Navya addressed the long-standing curiosity around whether she was ever expected to carry forward the cinematic legacy of her grandparents, Amitabh Bachchan and Jaya Bachchan.

title: Gujarat electoral rolls shrink 13% to 4.4 crore voters after 77 lakh deletions
content: Gujarat's voter count has dropped by 13.4% to 4.4 crore after a special revision removed 77 lakh names and added 9.5 lakh new electors. This significant decline follows two rounds of scrutiny, with over 40 lakh voters identified as permanently shifted and 18 lakh deceased.

title: Ajit Pawar plane's black boxes damaged in fire: AAIB
content: Black boxes from the crashed Learjet at Baramati airport sustained significant fire damage, the Aircraft Accident Investigation Bureau reported. While the flight data recorder was successfully downloaded, specialized help is needed for the cockpit voice recorder. This raises questions about the extent of damage, with experts and politicians calling the CVR's condition mysterious and serious, hinting at potential foul play.

title: Haryana STF nabs 2 Pak youths who fled Jammu juvenile home; hunt on for third fugitive
content: Two Pakistani nationals escaped a juvenile home in Jammu and were arrested 400km away in Ambala Cantonment railway station. They had broken out with a local gangster who injured two police officers. The Pakistani duo planned to flee the country via Nepal. The injured policemen are hospitalized. A fresh FIR has been registered against the trio.

title: Watch: Explosion at New York church; five injured
content: An explosion rocked Abundant Life Fellowship Church in Boonville, New York. Five people were injured in the blast. First responders arrived after reports of a gas odor. A firefighter and one civilian are in critical condition. The church suffered catastrophic damage. Investigations are ongoing into the cause of the explosion.

title: Tina Ambani skips ED summons, 2nd in a month
content: Tina Ambani, wife of Anil Ambani, missed her second Enforcement Directorate summons regarding a money laundering probe. Her husband, Anil Ambani, is also under investigation for a Rs 40,000 crore laundering case. The ED is seeking international cooperation to trace alleged illicit funds, having already conducted numerous searches and attached significant assets.

title: Decision on J&K statehood 'soon'? Omar presses Centre after law minister's statement
content: Jammu and Kashmir Chief Minister Omar Abdullah expressed cautious optimism following Union Law Minister Arjun Meghwal's statement on the imminent restoration of statehood.  Abdullah highlighted the prolonged wait since the elected government took office, emphasizing that patience is wearing thin.  He stressed that statehood is a crucial and sensitive matter, with the Supreme Court also urging its prompt return.

content: the united states and Canada are on opposite sides of the 2026 Olympic men's hockey tournament bracket . the winger's seven points through four games ties him with Jaromir Jagr . he has been awesome for Czechia .

title: Why is the Champions League so easy for Premier League teams now?
content: the UEFA Champions League playoff round kicks off this week . the defending champs of both the Eredivisie and Serie A didn't make the playoffs . they were eliminated from the league phase, as were two clubs from LaLiga .

title: The biggest surprises of the men's Olympic hockey tournament
content: the 2026 men's hockey tournament has been thoroughly entertaining from start to finish . there is no other tournament where the best players are available to represent their countries with so much on the line . not every nation participated in last year's 4 Nations face-off .

title: Maharashtra Nullifies 5% Quota For Muslims, It Was In Limbo Since 2014
content: The Devendra Fadnavis government in Maharashtra has officially nullified the 5 per cent reservation provided to Muslims in the state in government jobs and education. A new Government Resolution announcing this decision has been issued.

title: NDTV AI Summit 2026 LIVE Updates: Fireside Chats With Rishi Sunak, OpenAI Top Official Today
content: AI Impact Summit 2026 LIVE Updates: The five-day AI Impact Summit began on Monday with Prime Minister Narendra Modi inaugurating the expo featuring 600 startups and 13 country pavilions.

title: BJP To Take Out 9 Parivartan Rath Yatras Ahead Of Polls In West Bengal
content: The first phase of yatra will begin from Cooch Behar South, Krishnanagar South Garhbeta, and Raydighi Kulti on March 1.

title: Allegations In Epstein Files May Amount To 'Crimes Against Humanity': UN Experts
content: The experts said crimes outlined in documents released by the US Justice Department were committed against a backdrop of supremacist beliefs, racism, corruption, and extreme misogyny.

title: Defence, AI, Nuclear Push: Decoding India-France's "Special Global" Partnership
content: India and France have announced a sweeping upgrade of their bilateral relationship to a "special global strategic partnership", marking a decisive deepening of cooperation across defence, artificial intelligence, and nuclear energy, among others.

title: Delhi Biker Opens Doors Of Moving Buses For Reels. His Arrest Is Now Viral
content: A 22-year-old man in northeast Delhi has been arrested for allegedly performing dangerous stunts on a motorcycle and harassing bus passengers to shoot reels for social media, police said on Tuesday.

title: California Surfing Legend Murdered During Robbery At His Home In Costa Rica
content: Kurt Van Dyke, a 66-year-old Costa Rica resident and local hotel owner in Puerto Viejo on the country's Caribbean coast, was killed Saturday, according to the Judicial Investigation Agency.

title: Pulling Pyjama String Rape Attempt: Top Court Sets Aside High Court Order
content: Supreme Court has asked the National Judicial Academy to constitute a committee of experts to draft guidelines for approach of judges when dealing with cases of sexual offences.

title: Rape Accused Beaten To Death By Friends, Body Dumped In Haridwar Forest
content: A man in Dehradun was allegedly beaten to death with a baseball bat by friends, who later buried the body in the Chidiyapur forests in Haridwar, police said on Tuesday.

title: Bill Gates-Backed Breakthrough Energy Halts New Investment, Lays Off Staff
content: Breakthrough Energy, the Bill Gates-backed group that bankrolls climate tech, has stopped making new investments from one of its key funds to scale up nascent green technologies.

title: Caught A Bug After Weeks Of Travel: NVIDIA On CEO's Absence From AI Summit
content: Amid questions over CEO Jensen Huang's absence at the India AI Impact Summit, NVIDIA managing director for South Asia, Vishal Dhupar, said the top official was unwell after weeks of extensive travel and has deputed Jay Puri to lead delegation.

title: YouTube Suffers Global Outage, Says "Working On A Full Fix"
content: Video sharing site YouTube suffered a widespread outage late Tuesday, with hundreds of thousands of users reporting issues from around the world.

title: After Indus Water Move, India Plans To Cut Pakistan's Access To Ravi Waters
content: With summers on the horizon, Pakistan's water woes may worsen as India is planning to halt the flow of surplus water from the Ravi to Pakistan.

title: AI To Become Backbone Of India's Future Warfare: DRDO Chief To NDTV
content: Speaking to NDTV on the sidelines of the AI Summit in New Delhi, Chandrika Kaushik underlined that AI will play a decisive role in national security.

title: Zohran Mamdani Threatens New York Property Tax Hike As Last-Resort
content: New York City Mayor Zohran Mamdani has thrown down an ultimatum, threatening to raise property taxes by nearly 10% as a way to lobby Governor Kathy Hochul for more funding.

title: Ajit Pawar Plane's Black Boxes Damaged In Fire: Probe Body
content: The Aircraft Accident Investigation Bureau (AAIB) is carrying out a detailed investigation into the accident involving Learjet 45 aircraft VT-SSK at Baramati on 28 January 2026.

title: "Not Charity, But A Right": Court On Maintenance For Estranged Wife
content: The Andhra Pradesh High Court has affirmed that awarding maintenance to an estranged wife is not charity but a right, whose enforcement is essential to uphold equity, justice and good conscience.

title: "Global Order Changing, Now Headed To Long Twilight Zone": S Jaishankar
content: India is engaging with international partners more intensively and from a "position of strength", External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar said on Tuesday, citing a string of recent trade agreements as evidence of the country's growing economic clout.

title: Kerala Biker, 27, Dies After Falling Into Roadside Pit, Probe Ordered
content: A 27-year-old man died after allegedly falling into an open roadside pit near Thodupuzha in Idukki district, police said on Tuesday.

content: The TOI Science Desk stands as an inquisitive team of journalists, ceaselessly delving into the realms of discovery to curate a captivating collection of news, features, and articles from the vast and ever-evolving world of science for the readers of The Times of India. Whether it's the intricacies of genetic engineering, the marvels of space exploration, or the latest in artificial intelligence, the TOI Science Desk ensures you stay connected to the pulse of the scientific world. At the TOI Science Desk, we are not just reporters; we are storytellers of scientific narratives. We are committed to demystifying the intricacies of science, making it accessible and engaging for readers of all backgrounds. title: Hate speech PIL 'targets' BJP CMs: Supreme Court
content: 12 'eminent' petitioners filed a PIL "targeting" CMs of BJP-governed states for alleged hate speeches . a senior advocate told a bench that the country's atmosphere had become toxic . the petition had selectively named individuals while highlighting the problem .
